column1: The Swanfleet or Nîn-in-Eilph was a marshy area in eastern Eriador through which the lower reaches of the Glanduin (or "Swanfleet river") flowed before it joined the Mitheithel (Hoarwell). The Swanfleet was effectively an inland delta
column2: with uncertain streams and a very uncertain difference between land and water.

column1: It strongly resembled the Gladden Fields on the other side of Misty Mountains
column2: and as such many Stoors felt right at home here after their migration into Eriador. These Stoors remained here until the Great Plague nearly wiped them out
column3: and the remainder then went to the Southfarthing of the Shire.

column1: At the east end of the Swanfleet was a waterfall
column2: beyond which was a ford over the Glanduin
column3: from where led a road to the ruins of Ost-in-Edhil

column1: The name Nîn-in-Eilph is Sindarin for "water-lands of the Swans".
